meanings.definition: Not capable of moving or being moved.
meanings.sent1: The heavy boulder was nonmobile and stayed in the same spot for years.
meanings.sent2: The nonmobile tree stood tall in the forest, providing shade for animals.
meanings.sent3: The nonmobile rock tried to join the race but quickly realized it couldn't move.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were nonmobile, stuck in the same pattern without any new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The nonmobile glacier seemed frozen in time, unmoving and majestic.

meanings.definition: Not able to be easily transported or carried.
meanings.sent1: The nonmobile piano was too heavy to lift and move to another room.
meanings.sent2: The nonmobile refrigerator was a challenge to relocate due to its weight.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the nonmobile wardrobe up the stairs proved to be a difficult task.
meanings.sent4: Her suitcase, filled with books, felt nonmobile as she struggled to lift it off the ground.
meanings.sent5: The nonmobile safe was securely bolted to the floor, impossible to steal.

meanings.definition: Not involving or relating to movement.
meanings.sent1: The nonmobile painting on the wall captured a moment frozen in time.
meanings.sent2: The nonmobile statue in the park depicted a historical figure.
meanings.sent3: The nonmobile clock on the wall seemed to be stuck at the same time.
meanings.sent4: His nonmobile expression gave no hint of what he was thinking.
meanings.sent5: The nonmobile clouds in the sky painted a beautiful picture that never changed.
